intro: Ambaiba goudotiana, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its flowers are small but intricately patterned, often displaying shades of yellow, green, and red. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Ambaiba goudotiana is considered a vulnerable species.
